sage.app

Class VariableFrameRateGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.app.AbstractGame
      • sage.app.VariableFrameRateGame

  • public abstract class VariableFrameRateGame
extends AbstractGame

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      VariableFrameRateGame() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void exit()
      exit() is invoked to exit the game.
      float getFramesPerSec()
      Returns the instantaneous frame rate -- that is, the rate at which frames have been generated since the last call to getFramesPerSec() (or since the last call to setFrameRate()).
      boolean isGameOver()
      Returns true if the game has been terminated by a call to setGameOver(true).
      protected void mainLoop()
      mainLoop() executes the "main loop" of a game, by repeatedly invoking AbstractGame.handleInput(float), AbstractGame.update(float), and AbstractGame.render() until AbstractGame.isGameOver() returns true.
      void setGameOver(boolean isOver)
      Sets the game over flag to the value of parameter
      void start()
      start() is the entry point for every game; it should be invoked from main() to begin the game.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

      • VariableFrameRateGame

        public VariableFrameRateGame()

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public final void start()
        Description copied from class: AbstractGame
        start() is the entry point for every game; it should be invoked from main() to begin the game. Every implementation of start() should invoke AbstractGame.initSystem(), AbstractGame.initGame(), and then AbstractGame.mainLoop(), followed by invoking AbstractGame.shutdown() and AbstractGame.exit() after AbstractGame.mainLoop() returns.
        Specified by:
        start in class AbstractGame

      • mainLoop

        protected final void mainLoop()
        Description copied from class: AbstractGame
        mainLoop() executes the "main loop" of a game, by repeatedly invoking AbstractGame.handleInput(float), AbstractGame.update(float), and AbstractGame.render() until AbstractGame.isGameOver() returns true.
        Specified by:
        mainLoop in class AbstractGame

      • setGameOver

        public final void setGameOver(boolean isOver)
        Sets the game over flag to the value of parameter
        Specified by:
        setGameOver in class AbstractGame
        Parameters:
        isOver - True if the game is over
        See Also:
        AbstractGame.mainLoop()

      • isGameOver

        public final boolean isGameOver()
        Description copied from class: AbstractGame
        Returns true if the game has been terminated by a call to setGameOver(true).
        Specified by:
        isGameOver in class AbstractGame
        Returns:
        - the current game-over flag state

      • getFramesPerSec

        public final float getFramesPerSec()
        Returns the instantaneous frame rate -- that is, the rate at which frames have been generated since the last call to getFramesPerSec() (or since the last call to setFrameRate()).
        Returns:
        the current frames-per-second value
